com.test.pool
Interface Pool.Validator<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of objects to validate and cleanup.
Enclosing interface:
Pool<T>
public static interface Pool.Validator<T>

Represents the functionality to validate an object of the pool and to subsequently perform cleanup activities.

Author:
Swaranga

Method Summary
 void invalidate(T t)
          Performs any cleanup activities before discarding the object.
 boolean isValid(T t)
          Checks whether the object is valid.
 

Method Detail

isValid

boolean isValid(T t)
Checks whether the object is valid.

Parameters:
t - the object to check.
Returns:
true if the object is valid else false.

invalidate

void invalidate(T t)
Performs any cleanup activities before discarding the object. For example before discarding database connection objects, the pool will want to close the connections. This is done via the invalidate() method.

Parameters:
t - the object to cleanup
